memberdef.argsstring: (q15_t *pSrc16, uint32_t fftLen, const q15_t *pCoef16, uint32_t twidCoefModifier)
memberdef.name: riscv_radix4_butterfly_q15

briefdescription.para: Core function for the Q15 CFFT butterfly process.

detaileddescription.para:
end of ComplexFFT group
pSrc16
points to the in-place buffer of Q15 data type
fftLen
length of the FFT
pCoef16
points to twiddle coefficient buffer
twidCoefModifier
twiddle coefficient modifier that supports different size FFTs with the same twiddle factor table
none

memberdef.argsstring: (q15_t *pSrc, uint32_t fftLen, uint16_t bitRevFactor, const uint16_t *pBitRevTab)
memberdef.name: riscv_bitreversal_q15

parameterdescription.para: points to in-place Q15 data buffer
bit reversal modifier that supports different size FFTs with the same bit reversal table

briefdescription.para: Processing function for the Q15 CFFT/CIFFT.

xrefdescription.para:
Do not use this function. It has been superseded by riscv_cfft_q15 and will be removed in the future.
S
points to an instance of the Q15 CFFT/CIFFT structure.
pSrc
points to the complex data buffer. Processing occurs in-place.
none

simplesect.title: Input and output formats:
simplesect.para: Internally input is downscaled by 2 for every stage to avoid saturations inside CFFT/CIFFT process. Hence the output format is different for different FFT sizes. The input and output formats for different FFT sizes and number of bits to upscale are mentioned in the tables below for CFFT and CIFFT:

para.image: Input and Output Formats for Q15 CFFT
Input and Output Formats for Q15 CIFFT
